SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Marfan syndrome (MFS) is the most common inherited disorder of connective tissue affecting multiple organ systems
The most life-threatening and life-shortening complication is aortic dissection
Without surgery, life expectancy of MFS patients is reduced to approximately 32 years
Early identification and appropriate multidisciplinary medical cooperation is essential
CONCLUSION: Proper follow up, therapy and timely surgical repair lead to an almost normal lifespan in affected individuals
